Background.text:
Also called Reticulocytopenia: abnormal decrease of reticulocytes in the body
Clinically common in
Sickle cell crisis
and
Hereditary Spherocytosis (HS)

Clinical_Features.text:
Sickle cell crisis
Anemia
Increased
fatigue
, pallor
Activity intolerance
Shortness of breath

Causes.text:
Erythema Infectiosum (Fifth disease)
Invades and destroys red blood cell precursors and halts the red cell production
EBV
Strep
infection
Use of
hydroxyurea

Labs.text:
CBC with retic count
Decrease from baseline hemoglobin/hematocrit
Precipitous drop in reticulocyte count (or lack of response)

Management.text:
Transfusion
using extended antigen-typed, leuko-depleted pRBCs
Droplet precautions

Recovery_Phase.text:
Typically in 1-2 weeks
Often marked by hyperbilirubinemia, and called a “hyperhemolytic” phase
[1]

Also_See.text:
Erythema Infectiosum (Fifth disease)
Hereditary Spherocytosis (HS)
Sickle cell crisis
